page.description: An overview of Alpha Anywhere's table menu functions.

section.title: Insert > Table
section.description: Displays the Insert Table dialog, which allows you to define table characteristics, then inserts the table at the cursor location. Web publishing applications only.

section.title: Insert > Row
section.description: Inserts a row below the cursor location.

section.title: Insert > Column
section.description: Inserts a column to the left of the cursor location.

section.title: Insert > Cell
section.description: Inserts a cell to the left of the cursor location.

section.title: Merge Cells
section.description: Merges two or more adjacent cells in the same row. Note : You cannot merge cells in different rows. You cannot select multiple cells in a single column.

section.title: Split Cell
section.description: Splits a table cell into two cells.

section.title: Properties > Table
section.description: Displays the Table Properties dialog. Here you can set:

case.description: table width in pixels or percent
table border color (for single color borders)
table border light color (for two color borders)
table border dark color (for two color borders)

section.title: Properties > Cell
section.description: Displays the Cell Properties dialog. Here you can set:

case.description: cell width in pixels or percent
cell height in pixels or percent
cell border color (for single color borders)
cell border light color (for two color borders)
cell border dark color (for two color borders)

step.description: Display the WYSIWYG tab of your HTML Editor window.
Select the table cell to modify.
Select Table > Properties > Cell to display the Cell Properties dialog.
Click OK to apply your selections or Cancel to discard them.

section.description: The entries you see above produce the following HTML code.
section.example: width=10 background="C:\Wallpaper\michan_081003.jpg" height=10 vAlign=top borderColor=#99cc00 borderColorLight=#ff0000 align=left bgColor=#ffcc00 borderColorDark=#3366ff colSpan=2 rowSpan=2 >

step.description: Display the WYSIWYG tab of your HTML Editor window.
Select Table > Properties > Table to display the Table Properties dialog.
Click OK to apply your selections or Cancel to discard them.

section.description: The entries you see above produce the following HTML code.
